question_text: A user sets up Windows Hello face authentication, but the system fails to recognize their face during login. Which of the following is the LEAST likely reason?
answer_options: The laptop camera is blocked or malfunctioning
The user is not sitting directly in front of the camera
The fingerprint reader is disabled in BIOS
Lighting conditions in the room have changed dramatically
correct_answer: The fingerprint reader is disabled in BIOS
explanation: Fingerprint reader settings are unrelated to face authentication. All other options affect facial recognition reliability.
